title: Distributors and Fur Elise
body: This phlog is a little outdated, so you'll have to excuse my lack of beard. This is a stack of paperwork that took us 3 months to fill out. Each distributor required us to complete a credit application and master licensing agreement. Some of the forms were smallish (2 to 3 pages), others were heart-attack-inducing-ish (30+ pages, not including addendums). Nicole made color folders for each studio. I'm talking on my cell phone, but you can't see it. Why, you ask? Because it's invisible. Would you look at all that hair! One of the distributors was kind enough to supply us with a S.A.S.E. - Silver Almond Syrup Extractor. This is a picture of an envelope. After the horror and carnage of the distribution forms, our friend Mora stopped by to accompany me on piano. I believe we were signing "Killing Me Softly" in this shot. "I hate it when they close their eyes."
author: Dan

comments.author: Chuck
comments.body: I used to drive past all those studios.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: That was the fastest comment of all time.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I make color folders for everything.

comments.author: Chuck
comments.body: Did I get it like... three seconds after you posted it?

comments.body: I love the "About a Boy" quote.  Good job.

comments.body: You're a sharp one, Oz! A+++
